pullRequest.body:
The old version of this file has a remark saying "TODO: In fact, in `AddCommGrp` there is a much nicer model of colimits as quotients of finitely supported functions, and we really should implement this as well (or instead)."

This PR does precisely this (choosing the "instead" option). In fact, given a functor `F : J ⥤ AddCommGrp.{w}`, it constructs a candidate for the colimit of `F` as a quotient of `DFinsupp (fun j ↦ F.obj j)`, without any smallness assumptions on `J`. It then proves that this quotient is a colimit of `F` if it is `w`-small, then deduces that `AddCommGrp.{w}` has all small colimits.


---

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

Current commit [19874ec12b](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/19874ec12b01e89c83c3cb882901a9f1a5f1c063)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/2151100a-8324-460a-bde1-61940bae0bab) for commit 75fa8cfef3f73f65ba83ef113cf86fec33ae26e9.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/f0607784-2565-4846-8029-aa15d6e881d7/to/2151100a-8324-460a-bde1-61940bae0bab) against commit e6514e003e72760a7506240a95c3679ee828c8ab:
```diff
  Benchmark                                              Metric         Change
  ============================================================================
- ~Mathlib.Algebra.Category.Grp.Colimits                 instructions   126.9%
+ ~Mathlib.Algebra.Category.ModuleCat.Presheaf.Abelian   instructions   -80.1%
+ ~Mathlib.Condensed.Discrete.Module                     instructions   -16.7%
```

```suggestion
```
This is because `Quot` is a `def`, not an `abbrev`. Abbreviations are unfolded when looking for instances. For a `def`, it is possible to set up a different instance if we want.
Okay, thanks for the explanation.

The last two lines can be done by `simpa only [ι] at h j x`, and `simpa [ι] at h j x` does the three last lines of code.
A more compact syntax would be:
```suggestion
    (h : ∀ (j : J) (x : F.obj j), f (Quot.ι F j x) = g (Quot.ι F j x)) : f = g :=
  QuotientAddGroup.addMonoidHom_ext _ (DFinsupp.addHom_ext (by simpa [ι] using h))
```
Actually, just `....addHom_ext h` would work.
I made the proof `QuotientAddGroup.addMonoidHom_ext _ (DFinsupp.addHom_ext h)` then.

```suggestion
  dsimp
```

`dsimp` is usually faster that `simp` (even a "squeezed" simp), and a plain `dsimp` makes more readable code:
```suggestion
    dsimp
```

```suggestion
    dsimp
```

```suggestion
    exact Quot.addMonoidHom_ext F (by simp [← hm])
```

Very recently, the following `where`-type syntax has become possible. It is advisable to use it:
```suggestion
    { app j :=
        AddCommGrp.ofHom (Shrink.addEquiv.symm.toAddMonoidHom.comp (Quot.ι F j))
      naturality _ _ _ := by
```

Here, you may use `congr_fun`:
```suggestion
  have : Small.{w} (DFinsupp (fun j ↦ F.obj j)) :=
    small_of_injective (f := fun x j ↦ x j) (fun f f' eq ↦ by
      ext j
      exact congr_fun eq j)
```

```suggestion
  change (c.ι.app j ≫ hc.desc (toCocone F f)) _ = _
```

```suggestion
If `J` is `w`-small, then any functor `J ⥤ AddCommGrp.{w}` has a colimit.
```
It seems this intermediate smallness property is a general result for `DFinSupp` types: it should be stated as a general instance in the most appropriate file. (Otherwise, the PR looks ok to me.)

I was not sure where to put this, since `Data.DFinsupp.Defs` is already pretty long. There's a file`Data.DFinsupp.FiniteOrInfinite` that just provides four `finiteness/infiniteness` theorems/instances for `DFinsupp`, and is currently not imported by anything. My suggestion is to rename it `Data.DFinsupp.Size` and to add the smallness instance there.
As `Small` does not seem to be known by that file, I would suggest creating a new file `DFinsupp.Small`.
Ok.

pullRequest.title: refactor(Algebra/Category/Grp/Colimits): change the construction of colimits in `AddCommGrp`

source.title: feat(Algebra/Category/Grp/Ulift): the universe lifting functor for commutative additive groups preserves colimits

nodes.body: !bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/2151100a-8324-460a-bde1-61940bae0bab) for commit 75fa8cfef3f73f65ba83ef113cf86fec33ae26e9.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/f0607784-2565-4846-8029-aa15d6e881d7/to/2151100a-8324-460a-bde1-61940bae0bab) against commit e6514e003e72760a7506240a95c3679ee828c8ab:
```diff
  Benchmark                                              Metric         Change
  ============================================================================
- ~Mathlib.Algebra.Category.Grp.Colimits                 instructions   126.9%
+ ~Mathlib.Algebra.Category.ModuleCat.Presheaf.Abelian   instructions   -80.1%
+ ~Mathlib.Condensed.Discrete.Module                     instructions   -16.7%
```
